# mall

## Intro

Run multiple LLM predictions against a data frame. The predictions are processed row-wise over a specified column. It works using a pre-determined one-shot prompt, along with the current rowâ€™s content.

## Install

To install from Github, use:

```python
pip install "mall @ git+https://git@github.com/mlverse/mall.git@python#subdirectory=python"
```

## Examples

```{python}
#| include: false
import polars as pl
from polars.dataframe._html import HTMLFormatter
html_formatter = get_ipython().display_formatter.formatters['text/html']
html_formatter.for_type(pl.DataFrame, lambda df: "\n".join(HTMLFormatter(df).render()))
```


```{python}
import mall 
import polars as pl
data = mall.MallData
reviews = data.reviews
```

```{python}
#| include: false
reviews.llm.use(options = dict(seed = 100))
```


## Sentiment

```{python}
reviews.llm.sentiment("review")
```

## Summarize

```{python}
reviews.llm.summarize("review", 5)
```

## Translate (as in 'English to French')

```{python}
reviews.llm.translate("review", "spanish")
```

## Classify

```{python}
reviews.llm.classify("review", ["computer", "appliance"])
```

## LLM session setup

```{python}
reviews.llm.use(options = dict(seed = 100))
```
